subject: RE: [junit] problem setting up ant target for junit
msgSnippet: Hi Nilesh, Actually upon further inspection of the build.xml I realized that the classes are being built and deployed in the same directory as the source which
messageBody:
Hi Nilesh,
Actually upon further inspection of the build.xml I
realized that the classes are being built and deployed
in the same directory as the source which is
${tst.dir}
So the question still holds. I am still not clear why
the script is unable to find the class.
vijay

--- "Thali, Nilesh" <nilesh.thali@...> wrote:
> I don't see the location of the class(es) being
> tested (TestExample for instance)
> in the classpath
>
> > <path id="classpath.base">
> > </path>
> > <path id="classpath.test">
> > <pathelement
> location="e:/junit3.8.1/junit.jar" />
> > <pathelement location="${tst-dir}" />
> > <path refid="classpath.base" />
> > </path>
>
> which is what it's complaining about:
>
> > [junit] TestExample
> > [junit] java.lang.ClassNotFoundException:
> > TestExample
>
> regards,
> Nilesh
>
